abstracts.cdata!:
This publication is part of a collection
            of five studies conducted by external consultants who were
            attached to various departments of Public Administration and
            Federal Coordination and who were in the Ministry of
            Environment and Natural Resources. The objective was to
            analyze the implications for sustainable development issues
            as diverse as water management, development of financial
            instruments for the sound management of forest resources,
            strategies for development of tourism with sustainability,
            tax incentives for proper utilization of natural resources
            and environmental protection. To meet the social needs of
            the population, to promote the growth of the economy and
            also to incorporate into development policy the
            preservation, protection and rational utilization of
            ecosystems and the environment requires the integration of
            sustainability into public policy building. Faced with
            environmental degradation and destruction and degradation of
            natural resources, the alternative is not extreme
            conservation and implementation of legal constraints.
            Rather, exercise of authority simply is not enough in a
            society characterized by deep inequalities and deprivation
            for large groups of people. Therefore, the federal
            government has promoted the mainstreaming in public policies
            to build a situation which has great impact on natural
            resources and the environment.
